result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Jermaine Morris

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties. Court re-schedules Plea hearing from 09/21/2022 at 9:30 am to 12/23/2022 at 10:00 am, before Br 16.

Defendant Richard Jermaine Morris in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Parties provide an update to the court. Court withdraws previous stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel requests an a PGP date, due to likelihood of reaching a resolution. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued but STAYED bench warrant until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Calendar call scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (12 pages) commencing 05-19-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Court sets deadline to file motion for 07/20/2022 at 5:00 pm. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Richard Jermaine Morris in court, defendant in custody with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn by video. John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Bartoshevich.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Richard Jermaine Morris in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Richard Jermaine Morris in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard Jermaine Morris appeared by video means with Attorney.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
